event.name: AEA_NECRO_VIRUS_TRAP
event.text: You find an abandoned Heretic ship in orbit around a moon. There are absolutely no signs of activity on the ship whatsoever.

As you board the vessel you discover a gruesome scene, as your Elite Engi examines the scene, they begin to convulse. It appears they touched the body of an Engi Heretic and were infected by some sort of virus, your engi has been replaced by an Elite Engi Heretic.

As you board the vessel you discover a gruesome scene, as your Engi examines the scene, they begin to convulse. It appears they touched the body of an Engi Heretic and were infected by some sort of virus, your engi has been replaced by an Engi Heretic.

As you board the vessel you discover a gruesome scene, as your Engi examines the scene, they begin to convulse. It appears they touched the body of an Engi Heretic and were infected by some sort of virus, your engi has been replaced by an Engi Heretic.

As you board the vessel you discover a gruesome scene, as your Engi examines the scene, they begin to convulse. It appears they touched the body of an Engi Heretic and were infected by some sort of virus, your engi has been replaced by an Engi Heretic.

choice.text: Blow the ship up and harvest the remains.

event.text: Destroying the ship is going to decrease the yield considerably, but doing so is safer than boarding it.
You avoid the ship - Separatists have been known to leave viruses behind for unwitting scavengers.
The ship being largely intact is a lucrative bounty of scrap and resources. You haul the bounty back to your ship with absolutely no resistance.
The ship being largely intact is a lucrative bounty of scrap and resources. As you scrap the ship, you discover a working drone schematic in the cargo bay.

event.name: AEA_NECRO_WORTHLESS_JUNK
event.text: You catch the two Separatists on the nearby ship squabbling over something about an augment. You hail them. "Yes, greetings. We have obtained object. Object's purpose is unknown, and our desire to keep it is 0. Please take this [worthless junk] off of our hands."

event.name: AEA_NECRO_FREE_CREW
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to discover a damaged Heretic vessel adrift in the void, You're hailed by an Engi Heretic. "Renegade, I am in need of [new] vessel, are you in need of [new] crew?"
The Engi Heretic inspects your crew as it boards, however it doesn't find any organic crew, satisfyied with your crew it willingly submits to you.
The Engi Heretic seems slightly angry at your refusal, although it appears relieved when it notices an organic crewmember in the background of the feed.

As the Engi Heretic boards your vessel it looks over your crew. It notices your organic crew, "[Organics] are disgusting, however the need for a [new] vessel outweighs my contempt for your [disgusting] organics."
As the Engi Heretic boards your vessel it looks over your crew. It notices your organic crew, "[Organics] are disgusting, I will return to my [damaged] vessel."

event.name: AEA_NECRO_WRECK_EXPLODING
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to discover the wreck of a large Heretic vessel breaking up under the barrage of asteroids.

As you board the ship you're constantly reminded of the assualt by asteroids smashing into the hull, the sounds echoing through the empty halls.
You reach a crossroads in the hallway, there probably isn't enough to search all 3 paths. You read the markings above each direction.
You enter the engineering bay, the room is in ruins, however you're able to grab one of the few remaining drones before evacuating back to your own ship.

You enter the bridge of the ship, its evident the crew of this ship have long since fled the dying vessel. You're able to access their computers and download the complete sector map before being forced to retreat.
The cargo bay is relatively empty, what catches your eye is a large cage in the corner, inside you find a prisoner, they offer to join your crew if you just let them out.
It's not worth the risk.

event.name: AEA_NECRO_ORGANICS_HATE
event.text: You've arrive at the beacon to discover a Heretic vessel in orbit nearby. They contact you. "You don't happen to have a test subject do you? We require an organic."

choice.text: (Organic Crew) Hand over an organic crewmember for the Engi Heretics to test on.

event.text: The Engi Heretic seems slightly angry at your refusal, although it appears relieved when it notices an organic crewmember in the background of the feed.

You turn over your crewmember to the Heretics. After waiting a whilte you're about to demand your crewmember back when the Heretics reach out and tell you they're finished. They quickly send over your crewmember before jumping away.
Your crewmember is acting a little strange, however they also come with a bundle of scrap, so can you really complain.

You turn over your crewmember to the Heretics. After waiting a whilte you're about to demand your crewmember back when the Heretics reach out and tell you they're finished. They quickly send over your crewmember before jumping away.
It turns out they must have sent over the wrong crewmember, but they're well gone before you can follow up with them.

event.name: AEA_NECRO_UNION_CHOICE
event.text: A Heretic ship is locked in battle with a Union vessel. It appears to be a stalemate, neither ship winning over the other.
The Engi Heretics explain that they need the bodies of the humans for their war effort, the Union vessel rebuttals this by explaining that they don't want to die.
The Union vessel is outraged by your betrayal. The Heretics, glad to have the support pull back to give you room to engage.
"Renegade, I hope you're familiar with their tactics, they don't exactly fight fair."
You can hear the shots of the two ships echoing through your comms until you're a safe distance away.

event.name: AEA_NECRO_UNION_CHOICE_WIN
event.text: "Success achieved. You proved quite capable of dealing with these organics, perhaps you will accept me onto your ship?" The rest of the Heretics move to dock with the remains of the Union vessel, you shudder to think what they're doing over there.

event.name: AEA_NECRO_ENGI_CHOICE_WIN
event.text: "Renegade, we're thankful that you were here to save us, please take this drone as a reward."

event.name: AEA_NECRO_HERETIC_MORAL
event.text:
You arrive to find a Heretic vessel positioning itself for an assualt on a nearby settlement. You can hear the leader of the settlement trying to plead with them.
"You are wrong, we require your bodies for the war effort."
"Please, this is all wrong. You don't have to kill us, use drones or something, this is Cruel!"
"We do not understand, why would we create robots to do the job of organics, it is more efficient this way?"
"The role of organics is not to die and be resurrected for your cause, we have lives, families, feelings, we exist outside of your battles. Please, leave us out of this."

choice.text: Encourage the Engi Heretics to use drones instead.

event.text: "But we don't have any, there are plenty of humans right here for use."
"Perhaps the organics are right, this may serve our purposes. Perhaps we've been wrong about organics..."
"Perhaps the organics are right, this may serve our purposes. Perhaps we've been wrong about organics..."

choice.text: Give them a battle drone mk 2.

event.text: "Perhaps the organics are right, this may serve our purposes. Perhaps we've been wrong about organics..."

choice.text: Give them a battle drone mk 2.

event.text: "Perhaps the organics are right, this may serve our purposes. Perhaps we've been wrong about organics..."

choice.text: Give them directions to the nearest store, where they can buy all the drones they want.

event.text: Perhaps you are right, we will try drones before using these organics.
The settlement thanks you and offers you a small reward.

choice.text: Tell the heretics to do what they need.

event.text: "You are right, you also possess organics, we will take them for the cause."

choice.text: Tell the heretics to do what they need.

event.text: "You are right, organics are the way forward. Take this [drone] as a token of our support in your own quest against the organics known as the rebels."
You try not to listen as the Engi Heretics open up on the settlement.

event.name: AEA_NECRO_HERETIC_MORAL_REWARD
event.text: The settlement reaches out to you to profess their gratitude at getting the Engi Heretics to leave peacefully, they offer you a large reward and a drone.

event.name: AEA_NECRO_HERETIC_MORAL_REWARD2
event.text: The settlement reaches out to you to profess their gratitude at getting the Engi Heretics to leave peacefully, they offer you a large reward and a drone.

event.name: AEA_NECRO_BURY_BODIES
event.text: A ship floats by the beacon, it appears heavily damaged, some of the scorch marks are still hot.
You do a quick search of the ship, you find the crew, they're all dead. Who ever did this was certainly determined to kill them all.

choice.text: Give the bodies a proper burial on a nearby planet.

event.text:
As you're burying the bodies a large Heretic vessel appears nearby, they spot you and what you're doing.
"Those are ours, we'll have to take yours instead."

You recieve word from your crew back on your ship, returning to the ship you find a Heretic vessel bearing down on you.
"Those organics are ours, leave them to us."
The crew of the ship may not be alive to see it, but you'll avenge them anyway.

choice.text: Explain that you had no intentions of touching the bodies.

event.text: "Good, we only want the organics, you may have anything else." You're able to loot the vessel after the Heretics take their prizes.
You're not going to get involved with whatever is happening with that ship.

event.name: AEA_NECRO_MURDERBOTS
event.text: A Separatist ship floats around nearby, slowly distancing itself from you. You're somewhat baffled that quick scans show no crew aboard, but the ship seems fully functional and responsive.
The mystery of the ship doesn't matter to you. The only thing on your mind is the reward of blowing it up.
You try to reach out, but every time the ship picks up all you can hear is a faint buzzing noise.
The mystery of the ship doesn't matter to you. The only thing on your mind is the reward of blowing it up.
You've lost interest in the mystery, and prepare to move on.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Try to detect life signs.

event.text: Your Slug tries to sense some form of intelligence aboard the enemy ship. They detect faint signs of potential life, but it's near impossible for them to tell.
The mystery of the ship doesn't matter to you. The only thing on your mind is the reward of blowing it up.
You've lost interest in the mystery, and prepare to move on.

choice.text: (Telepathic Shell) Try to detect life signs.

event.text: Your Shell tries to sense some form of intelligence aboard the enemy ship. They detect faint signs of potential life, but it's near impossible for them to tell.
The mystery of the ship doesn't matter to you. The only thing on your mind is the reward of blowing it up.
You've lost interest in the mystery, and prepare to move on.
You have no desire to deal with the ship.

event.name: AEA_NECRO_FLEET_DELAY
event.text: A Heretic vessel hails you. "Your situation with the fleet is known. We have: proposition. Help us with killing hostile ship, and we will delay fleet."
"Rebel Auto-ships, although not organic, it is controlled by the organics. It is proving annoying to deal with. Will you help?"
The Heretics lead you to the location of the Auto-ship.
"I am -dissatisfied- with your response, but I will tolerate it. Try not to die, Captain."
"Disapointing. Try not to die."

event.name: AEA_NECRO_FLEET_DELAY_WIN
event.text: "Very good. Now for your compensation. Please do not move your [ship]." The Heretics run a scan over your vessel, giving you a tingly feeling all over your body. The Heretics hail you again, this time looking very similar to you. "My job is less than 100%, but it will work for now. I have masked your jump signature. The fleet will now follow me. Good day."

event.name: AEA_NECRO_FLEET_DELAY_LOSE
event.text: "You have failed. Do not attempt to communicate with us again."

event.name: DISTRESS_AEA_NECRO_PIRATE
event.text: You locate the distress beacon, it belongs to a small escape capsule, piloted by an Engi Heretic. "Organics have taken control of my [ship], we did not realize they were still alive, or else we would not have brought them onboard."
You approach the occupied vessel. "Glad to hear. Don't destroy [it]."
The Heretic seems annoyed and disconnects immediately.
"Wow. [You're] a real jerk, aren't you? What am I supposed [to] do now?" The Heretic ends the communication in a huff.
"You've destroyed my [property]. I -will- have my revenge." .

event.name: DISTRESS_AEA_NECRO_ZOMBIE_PLANET
event.text: Unusual for a Engi Heretic sector, there appears to be a populated planet here. The distress beacon is coming from a Heretic ship in orbit over it.
"Captain, we believe you may be able to assist us, we were attempting to resurrect the entire population, however something has gone wrong and we've lost control of the organics, please fix this"

choice.text: (Mind Control) Return the population to the control of the Engi Heretic.

event.text: You use your mind control system to bring them all back under control of the Engi Heretic.

choice.text: (Engi Crew) Head down to the planet and Interface with the nano-bots.

event.text: Your Engi is able to interface with the nano-bots on the surface and bring them under control of the Engi Heretic again.

choice.text: (Hacking) Hack the nano bots and return control to the Engi Heretic.

event.text: You're able to hack into the nano-bot system and elimate the function that inadvertently took control from the Engi Heretic.
You're able to use your medbay to synthasize a cure to the affliction of the people on the surface of the planet.
You're able to use your medical bomb to synthasize a cure to the affliction of the people on the surface of the planet.
Your medical crew are able to synthasize a cure to the affliction of the people on the surface of the planet.
The Engi Heretic is disapointed, but goes back to watching the planet.

event.name: AEA_NECRO_ZOMBIE_REWARD
event.text: "Excellent work Captain, Here's your reward for a job well done." The Engi Heretic turns back to continue monitoring the planet.

event.name: AEA_NECRO_ZOMBIE_FAILURE
event.text: "What is the meaning of this, is this some kind of trick! Prepare to die for your betrayal!" It appears the Engi Heretic didn't take you destroying their planet of zombies well.

textList.name: TEXT_DISTRESS_AEA_NECRO_TRAP_BEACON
textList.text: The ship projecting the distress beacon is a Heretic ship, they hail you. "You organics always fall for it, prepare to die and become my vassal!" It appears you've falled for the Heretic's trap.

"Captain, you should have [known] this was a fake distress beacon. The differing micro-oscillations and gamma node frequencies are a -dead- giveaway. Only an organic would miss something so obvious, prepare to become my [slave]!"

event.name: QUEST_AEA_NECRO_ELITE
event.text: A squadron of Heretic ships have assembled at this beacon. They aren't immediately attacking you, their weapons aren't even online.

"Request for contact received. Timing is fortunate. We have an offer for you. Current objective: Eliminate the organics outpost. Organics have setup a powerful defense system to protect their outpost. Beware of asteroid field, previous attempts have [failed] when entering field and suddenly finding their [shields] offline."
"We will give an extra reward if you manage to keep the outpost intact." .
The Engi transmit the location of the outpost.
The Engi immediately end transmissions and will not respond to further hails.
The Heretic ships don't appear to be disturbed by your presence, and you leave them alone.

event.name: QUEST_AEA_NECRO_ELITE_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The pirate outpost you're tasked with clearing out by the Heretics.

event.text: As you arrive to the beacon you find yourself in a massive asteroid field. Not a moment later your shields begin to go down. You've been hacked. Your crew tells you it will only take 15 seconds to bring them back online, but you'll have to survive the asteroid field until then.
Your shield system is restored to full power.
Your shield system is restored to full power.
With no other choice your crew prepares to deal with the asteroid impacts.

event.name: QUEST_AEA_NECRO_ELITE_CONTINUE
event.text: With your shield system restored you push on towards the pirate outpost. As you get closer you realize this isn't any normal station, instead it appears the pirates have gotten their hands on a specialized militia platform equipped with a large weapon. This isn't going to be an easy fight.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_AEA_NECRO
textList.text: A short screech plays over the comms followed by a looping message of binary. You don't have time to translate before a Heretic Ship fires a warning shot that ricochets off your defenses.

A strangely verbose Engi hails you. "Unfortunate time of encounter, -Federation- ship. I appear to have [damaged] the part of my system that encodes for reason and logic, and now have the burning desire to kill."
An enraged Separatist hails you. "Problem: You have -accidentally- stepped on lifelong friend of [mine] in microscopic state. Solution: die."
Though Separatists usually avoid other ships, the one at this beacon appears to be in critical condition, and in desperate need of scrap.
A Separatist ship moves in to attack. You aren't sure how you angered them, but it no longer matters.
You're hailed by a Separatist ship, who begins to speak a great deal about the works of some dead guy named Shakespeare. He suddenly stops his speech abruptly and attacks!.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_ENGI_AEA_NECRO
event.text: A Heretic ship orbits the beacon, but before you can contact them they jump away and a Separatist ship approaches. "Captain, those Heretics were pushed out of the Separatists for a reason, they are dangerous, you are therefor dangerous, you must be dealt with aswell."

event.name: ENCOUNTER_REBEL_AUTO_AEA_NECRO
event.text: "We suggest you avoid the Auto-ship. It is broken." You notice the Separatist ship that hailed you hiding behind some large asteroids, as well as the Rebel Auto-ship barreling towards you!.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_REBEL_AUTO_AEA_NECRO_KILL
event.text: The Separatists let out something that sounds like a robotic laugh. "Good, I see why others get much [enjoyment] out of watching gladiatorial combat." They jump away, leaving you with the wreck of the Auto-ship.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_ZOLTAN_AUTO_AEA_NECRO
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to be unexpectedly confronted by a Zoltan Auto-ship, it seems like it's been infected by some sort of virus becuase it's about to open up on you.

event.name: HARMONY_LINK_AEA_NECRO

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is the location of a Harmony Link.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: This is the location of a Harmony Link.

event.text: It appears you've discovered a Harmony Link. These massive planet-sized structures are made up of trillions of nanobots, and transmit a strong signal to all of the Engi in the sector. However, it appears this one has been corrupted by the Heretics, they now use the nanobots to resurrect the bodies of their enemies.

event.name: HARMONY_LINK_AEA_NECRO_RESURRECTED_MFK
event.text: As you're observing the link from afar you notice a large vessel immerge from the link, what surprises you is the fact that it's an MFK ship.
You're hailed by a nearby Engi Heretic. "Captain, your timing is perfect, you're here just in time to test our newest project." With that the MFK ship turns it's attention towards you.

event.name: HARMONY_LINK_AEA_NECRO_MFK_WIN
event.text: "Hmm, it appears the organics you call the rebels are not performing optimally, we will have to improve the process." The Engi Heretics seem disapointed by your victory, but only becuase their rebels failed.

event.name: HARMONY_LINK_AEA_NECRO_RESURRECTED_FED
event.text: As you're observing the link from afar you notice a large vessel immerge from the link, what surprises you is the fact that it's an Elite Federation ship.
You're hailed by a nearby Engi Heretic. "Captain, your timing is perfect, you're here just in time to test our newest project." With that the Federation ship turns it's attention towards you.

event.name: HARMONY_LINK_AEA_NECRO_FED_WIN
event.text: "Hmm, it appears the organics you call the federation are not performing optimally, we will have to improve the process." The Engi Heretics seem disapointed by your victory, but only becuase their zombies failed.

event.name: HARMONY_LINK_UNIQUE_AEA_NECRO

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is the location of a Harmony Link.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: This is the location of a Harmony Link.

event.text: It appears you've discovered a Harmony Link. Usually these are massive planet sized structures however this one has been corrupted by the Engi Heretics. Worse they appear to be using it to attempt to resurrect a massive space whale.
As you get closer a massive Heretic cruiser emerges from the Link, it appears to be barring you passage. "Leave, this is not something for the likes of you."
The Heretic cruiser activates it's weapons, it looks like you're not going to get past without a fight.
The Heretic cruiser continues to observe you as you back off to a save distance.
The Heretic ships don't appear to be disturbed by your presence, and you leave them alone.

event.name: LINK_AEA_NECRO_WHALE_FINISH
event.text: Now that you've dealt with the Heretic cruiser you're able to access the site of the resurrection. Eventually you make it to the control center of the structure, and inside you find a strange weapon mounted to it, pointing directly at the beast.
You rip the weapon from it's housing and retreat back to your ship, its not going to take the Engi long to realize something is wrong.
You grab any scrap you can from the structure before retreating back to your ship, its not going to take the Engi long to realize something is wrong.

event.name: AEA_NECRO_SANCTUM

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is the location of a Harmony Link.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: This is the location of a Harmony Link.

event.text: You've arrived at the Heretic's sanctum, one of the most important locations to the Heretics, this is where the upper command of the Heretics manipulate their forces to fight off their many enemies.
It appears some kind of event is going down on the surface, hundreds of Engi Heretics are assembled in an open area, apparently waiting.

As you watch, a gilded Heretic emerges from a building nearby and behind it a prisoner in chains. The prisoner appears to be rebel general, although dirty you can still make out the distinctive uniform.
The gilded Engi brings the general onto the raised platform, before bringing out a large blade. A moment later the general is dead, skewered by the sword. .

The gilded Engi isn't finished with the general, instead the Engi sticks it's arm into the wound.
A moment later the general is alive again, however this time something is different. No longer struggling against the chains the general appears to be under full control of the gilded Engi.
It isn't but a moment later before a Heretic vessel interrupts you with their weapons.
It's not worth the risk poking into things you know nothing about.

event.name: AEA_NECRO_SANCTUM_WIN
event.text: With the Heretic vessel destroyed you recieve an unexpected hail coming from the surface. "Greetings Captain, you were very efficient in destroying my vessel, I may have a use for you."

"The general you saw on display here, quite valuable to the rebel organics, we've picked up their weak attempt to save the general at the edge of the sector. However our forces are spread to thin to deal with it, you may be able to, if you do we will reward you handsomely."
"Try not to die Captain." The coordinates for the vessel are uploaded to your computer.
"Very well, Try not to die Captain."

event.name: QUEST_AEA_NECRO_SANCTUM_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The dangerous rebel vessel you're tasked with destroyed by the gilded Engi

event.text: You arrive at the beacon, you don't pickup anything nearby. However you prepare your defenses just in case.
Not a moment too soon a ship appears from behind an asteroid, however their initial volley is easily defeated by your defenses.

event.name: AEA_NECRO_SANCTUM_ANGEL_WIN
event.text: A new vessel arrives at the beacon, you're once again hailed by the gilded Engi. "Congratulations on your victory Captain. I should formally introduce myself, My name is L-0031, however some call me the Lich King."

"You did quite well in defeating this foe, and for it we'll deliver the schematics for a cruiser we've been designing. However I also came here to ask something of you, I've spent too long building up the Engi Heretics, I've lived a long time, but I haven't truly experienced much. You're a capable ship, take me aboard and I will help kill whomever you want. This place will be fine without me."

choice.text: Welcome the engi onto your ship.

event.text: The engi comes onboard your ship, if you had to guess L-0031 has been around since the beginning of the Engi, perhaps even one of the first to seperate from the harmony.
"Very well, Try not to die Captain."
